Learning outcomes 1. Demonstrate a knowledge of the OSI model, TCP/IP model and IP addressing and network design (subnetting), as well as fundamental introductory concepts of cyber security. 2. Explain and use layer 2 and 3 based technology such as VLANs, the spanning-tree protocol, network management principles, routing protocols and associated tools. 3. Perform pc, router, switch, and WAN installation, configuration and troubleshooting including access control lists in extensive router-based internetworks and do so in a responsible and safe manner. Guidelines For this assignment you will be working in groups of three. You will be required to complete a report (2000-3000 words excluding the personal reflections) in which you will design a network, select the devices to implement it and critically discuss LAN and WAN devices and technologies you have used in its implementation. A packet tracer file containing the network configuration will also need to be submitted. The report should have a consistent layout and be divided into enumerated sections, sub- sections, sub-sub sections, etc. (eg 2, 2.1, 2.1.1). For references and bibliography, you are expected to use appropriate peer reviewed sources for developing your arguments and an appropriate referencing style as per the University regulations. A digital copy of the report should be submitted using blackboard/Turnitin (email submission will not be accepted). Important Please note the following details are not comprehensive or complete. You should clarify any questions you have with your lecturer as they arise. In addition, you are allowed to make any reasonable assumptions concerning the business and the network as long as they are properly documented. Report Structure All parts of the assignment are to follow the following report structure: a) Introduction, where you will discuss your plan for solving the problem introduced by the instructors b) Main Body where you will develop your arguments c) Considerations & recommendations to increase security d) References (where required) e) Appendixes A IP addressing table f) Appendix B configuration commands Report Formatting Formatting requirements for the report: o Font - please use Times New Roman (12pt size) o Word count 2500 (excluding appendixes) o Pages approximately 15+ pages with 1.5 spacing o Appendix and diagrams are not counted in the word count o Formatting should be neat, and appropriately referenced o Use proper English, grammar, and spell checking o Use Harvard Referencing Marks Break Down Section Allocated Marks Selection of Hardware Devices and types of Networks 5 VLSM based IP Addressing 10 Switch configurations (VLAN) 10 Router configuration (Routing, Redundancy, Line protection) 10 NAT 10 Redundancy 10 WAN technology discussion 5 Security Issues and Solutions 10 Network Configuration in packet tracer 10 Viva and Presentation 20 Scenario APIIT planning to expand its operations and establish a network with three new locations. The company aims to enhance collaboration, communication among its various branches. Network setup and the purpose of each location is explained below: Location 1: Main campus (HQ) The Main campus of APIIT will serve as the central hub for decision-making, strategic planning, and executive management. It has key departments such as Computing school, Business school, Academic administration, Human resource and marketing. The primary objectives for this location are effective coordination, efficient data management, and secure communication within the organization. To achieve these objectives, the HQ will require a robust network infrastructure comprising high-speed internet connectivity, a dedicated server room, and advanced security measures. Location 2: Research and Development Center As the Research and Development (R&D) center in the company, it will focus on final year student projects, technological advancements, and experimental projects. It has key departments such as Research and Development, Human Resources, and Marketing. The network infrastructure at this center will targeting on high-speed data transfer, secure storage, and collaborations. Location 3: Branch (Kandy) The third location will be a campus works as the branch of APIIT, which is placed in Kandy. It also has key departments such as Computing school, Business school, additionally to manage the HR related questions there is an HR department with a smaller number of devices. Main Campus (Location) Sub Networks Number of Hosts Main campus (HQ) Computing school 200 Business school 100 Marketing 20 Human resource 20 Academic administration 8 Research and Development Human Resource 4 Marketing 8 Research and Development 20 Server Room 4 Branch-Kandy Computing school 80 Business school 40 Academic administration 6 Human resource 6 Marketing 4 The following Networks must be implemented at each location. You will need to subnet the networks based on the network block given to each group and your network plan should focus on reducing the IP addresses wastage. Requirements 1. The hardware devices and types of the networks that will be used to implement the network must be selected and justified. 2. Identify the suitable network design for the above network and explain why it is most suitable. 3. Design a three-layer network topology (Hierarchical Design) according to the above given specifications. Requirements such as redundancy, security and port aggregation must be considered in the design. 4. Find the suitable class for the IP address and explain why that class is suitable. 5. Create an appropriate IP addressing plan, do subnetting and document it using the following format for 3 locations. Location 1 Headquarters Subnet (Department) Number of Hosts Needed Size Allocated Size Subnetwork Address Actual Subnet Mask First Usable IP Address Last Usable IP Address Broadcast Address No. Of Unused IP Addresses 6. Use the following table to fill the IP addresses of all the end devices. Host/Device IP address Mask / Default Gateway 7. Identify at least 3-layer 2 technology you will implement in the designed network. Evaluate and justify why the selected technology is suitable for the design proposed by you. 8. Configure VLANS. 9. Configure Routing by selecting a suitable Routing protocol. Justify your selection in the report. 10. Configure redundancy in routers. 11. Configure Network Address Translation (NAT) where it is appropriate. 12. Identify at least 3-layer 3 technology you will implement in the designed network. Evaluate and justify why the selected technology is suitable for the design proposed by you. 13. Identify and explain at least 3 WAN technologies that could be used to implement the WAN connections. Select the most suitable WAN technology for the design proposed by you and provide justification for your selection. 14. Identify 3 potential security risks which can occur to the above network and provide solutions to overcome those problems. 15. Use Packet Tracer to implement the network including all associated technologies that are required for a fully functional network. 16. A written document must be produced indicating all relevant configuration details.
